cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest through the northwest Caribbean, forecast to cross the Yucatán late Saturday, then track northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-west/central Gulf Coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west/central Gulf Coast (most likely Louisiana coast, but Texas-Louisiana border is within the 5-day cone)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – watches confined to Honduras/Nicaragua at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – warnings confined to Honduras/Nicaragua at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatán Peninsula Saturday, then Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana line eastward to Mississippi/Alabama early next week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible if track shifts west or landfall occurs near TX-LA line
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible but currently uncertain; depends on exact landfall point and intensity
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (≤9%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions increasingly likely Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge possible along Sabine Pass Tuesday if the center tracks toward the TX-LA border
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could produce locally heavy rain totals >4 inches Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief marine squalls and higher seas in approach; possible navigation restrictions in the Sabine-Neches ship channel
